intro: Cyrtandra rufa, commonly known as the red-flowered heliconia, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Cyrtandra rufa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories in its natural habitat.
